Title: ARC ABMVIZ
SideBarTextLeft: ActivityViz was initially funded by the Atlanta Regional Commission with additional support from Oregon Metro and others.
SideBarTextRight: ActivityViz is an interactive travel and activity data visualization tool. It is built with JavaScript technologies and works with various types of travel and activity data - household travel surveys, trip-based model outputs, activity-based model outputs, disaggregate passive data, freight models, on-board surveys, etc. The dashboard features several interactive and customizable visualizations for exploring data, such as 3D maps of trips in time and space, time use by person type and activity, radar charts for performance measure analysis, sunburst diagrams for visualizing mode shares, animated bubble maps, chord diagrams for OD data, point-of-interest maps for transit stop data, truck flow data, etc. ActivityViz is published using GitHub pages which eliminates most of the administrative backend in traditional systems.

BarMap.name: Trip Mode
BarMap.info: Trip mode by zone and county

content: Frequency of trips by mode by county.
Fulton county has the largest share of transit trips.
For the left graph: Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove modes.
For the left graph: Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
For the map: Use the zone drop-down selection to view different trip modes as county colors.
For the map: Turn on bubbles under layers and use the bubbles drop-down selection to view different trip modes by county.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.

3DMap.name: Daytime Population
3DMap.info: People that are not in their home zone by time-of-day

content: Frequency of persons not at home by Transportation Analysis Zone (TAZ).
As the day progresses, people leave home, go to work, school, and other locations, and then return home in the evening.
Use the cycle through day button to animate the map.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.

datafilecolumns.PERSONS NOT AT HOME: Number of people not at home per zone and period

GroupedCharts.name: Day Patterns
GroupedCharts.info: Day patterns by person groupings

datafilecolumns.DAY PATTERN: Can be Home, Mandatory and Non-Mandatory
datafilecolumns.CHART: Which grouped chart they belong too

TimeUse.name: Time Use
TimeUse.info: Displays person out-of-home travel purpose by time of day. The vertical axis displays the sum or percent of activity and the horizontal axis displays the period of the day.

content: Activity by time of day
Derived from trip purpose and time at destination
Persons tend to be at home or work in the morning versus home, work, or other in the afternoon.
Hover mouse over bars to see detail by person type.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove trip purposes.

datafilecolumns.QUANTITY: Number of trips for specific purpose and person classification

Sunburst.name: Nested Mode Share
Sunburst.info: Nested Trip Mode Share.  Click a ring area to drill-down into the nest.  Click the center to go back up the nest.

RadarCharts.name: Performance Measures
RadarCharts.info: Activity centers by four performance measures.  The min/max by measure is scaled to the zone with the highest and lowest value.

Chord.name: Trip ODs
Chord.info: Trips by purpose and mode between super districts.

GroupedCharts.name: Number of Transfers between OD
GroupedCharts.info: How many transfers respondent took from their origin to their destination

datafilecolumns.TRANSFERS: First number is the number of transfer from their origin and second number is the number of transfers to their destination
datafilecolumns.CHART_TYPE: Which grouped chart they belong too

GroupedCharts.name: Origin Mode
GroupedCharts.info: Access mode respondent used from their origin

datafilecolumns.ORIGIN_TRANSPORT:
1=Walk

2=Wheelchair / Mobility Aid

3=Personal Bike

4=Bike share (Jump, Relay, etc.)

5=Was dropped off by someone going someplace else

6=Drove alone and parked

7=Drove or rode with others and parked

8=Uber, Lyft, etc.

9=Car share (e.g. Zipcar, etc.)

10=Taxi

11=E-scooter (e.g. Lime, Bird, etc.)

12=Shuttle

13=School Bus / Other Bus

14=Skateboard
datafilecolumns.CHART_TYPE: Which grouped chart they belong too

GroupedCharts.name: Origin Placetype
GroupedCharts.info: Type of place respondent is coming from now

datafilecolumns.ORIGIN_PLACE_TYPE:
1=Your usual WORKPLACE

2=Your HOME

3=Your Hotel or Lodging

4=Another Home

5=Store / Retail Place

6=Restaurant

7=School (K-12) / Day Care (student only)

8=College or University (student only)

9=Airport (airline passenger only)

10=Hospital / Doctor

11=Bank, or other office / Errands

12=Recreation Place

13=Place of Worship

14=Personal Business
datafilecolumns.CHART_TYPE: Which grouped chart they belong too

GroupedCharts.name: Resident or Visitor
GroupedCharts.info: If respondent indicated they were a resident or visitor to the area

datafilecolumns.CHART_TYPE: Which grouped chart they belong too

GroupedCharts.name: Opposite Direction Trip
GroupedCharts.info: If respondent took the same trip in the opposite direction

datafilecolumns.TRIP_IN_OPPO_DIR:
1=Yes - and I will/did use bus / rail

2=No

3=Yes - I will/did make a return trip but will/did NOT use the bus / rail
datafilecolumns.CHART_TYPE: Which grouped chart they belong too

GroupedCharts.name: Opposite Direction Trip Time
GroupedCharts.info: At what time did respondent board their return trip bus/rail

datafilecolumns.OPPO_DIR_TRIP_TIME:
AM1=Before 5:00 am

AM2=5:00 am - 6:00 am

AM3=6:00 am - 7:00 am

AM4=7:00 am - 8:00 am

AM5=8:00 am - 9:00 am

MID1=9:00 am - 10:00 am

MID2=10:00 am - 11:00 am

MID3=11:00 am - 12:00 noon

MID4=12:00 noon - 1:00 pm

MID5=1:00 pm - 2:00 pm

MID6=2:00 pm - 3:00 pm

PM1=3:00 pm - 4:00 pm

PM2=4:00 pm - 5:00 pm

PM3=5:00 pm - 6:00 pm

PM4=6:00 pm - 7:00 pm

PM5=7:00 pm - 8:00 pm

PM6=8:00 pm - 9:00 pm

PM7=9:00 pm - 10:00 pm

PM8=10:00 pm - 11:00 pm

PM9=11:00 pm and later
datafilecolumns.CHART_TYPE: Which grouped chart they belong too

GroupedCharts.name: Employment Status
GroupedCharts.info: Respondent's employment status

datafilecolumns.EMPLOYMENT_STATUS:
1=Employed full-time

2=Not currently employed, but seeking work

3=Retired

4=Employed part-time

5=Not currently employed, and not seeking work

6=Homemaker

GroupedCharts.name: Student Status

datafilecolumns.STUDENT_STATUS:

4=Yes - K - 12th grade

5=Yes - Other type of student

GroupedCharts.name: Type of Fare

datafilecolumns.TYPE_OF_FARE:
1=Regular Fare

2=Senior (65 and older)

3=Disabled/Medicare Discount

4=Regular (47in-64yo)

5=Youth (Under 18)

6=Medicare Card Holder

7=Child (Age 4-6)

8=Senior (60 and Older)

99=Other
datafilecolumns.CHART_TYPE: Which grouped chart they belong too

GroupedCharts.name: Used Breeze Card
GroupedCharts.info: If respondent indicated they used a Breeze Card

datafilecolumns.CHART_TYPE: Which grouped chart they belong too

GroupedCharts.name: How No Bus

datafilecolumns.HOW_NO_BUS:
1=Walk

2=Drive alone

3=Driven by someone else

4=Carpool / Vanpool

5=Uber, Lyft, etc

6=Would not make trip

7=Taxi

8=Bike share

9=Personal bike

99=Other
datafilecolumns.CHART_TYPE: Which grouped chart they belong too

GroupedCharts.name: Transit Use Frequency
GroupedCharts.info: On average, how many days a week respondent uses public transit

datafilecolumns.TRANSIT_USE_FREQ:
1=5 or more days a week

2=2 to 4 days a week

3=About once a week

4=2 to 3 times a month

5=About once a month

6=Several times a year

7=Once a year

8=First time
datafilecolumns.CHART_TYPE: Which grouped chart they belong too

GroupedCharts.info: Including respondent, how many household members are making the trip with respondent

datafilecolumns.CHART_TYPE: Which grouped chart they belong too

GroupedCharts.info: If respondent went to work or will go to work before returning home

2=Yes since left home

3=Yes before returning home

1=No

datafilecolumns.CHART_TYPE: Which grouped chart they belong too
